briefdescription.para: Event fires when the active state (ActionSet active and binding active) changes
Event fires when the active state of the binding changes
Event fires when the state of the pose or bones moves more than the changeTolerance
Event fires when the action is updated
Event fires when the state of the tracking system that is used to create pose data (position, rotation, etc) changes
Event fires when the state of the pose data retrieved for this action changes validity (good/bad data from the tracking source)
Event fires when the device bound to this action is connected or disconnected
An array of the positions of the bones from the most recent update. Relative to skeletalTransformSpace. See SteamVR_Skeleton_JointIndexes for bone indexes.
An array of the rotations of the bones from the most recent update. Relative to skeletalTransformSpace. See SteamVR_Skeleton_JointIndexes for bone indexes.
From the previous update: An array of the positions of the bones from the most recent update. Relative to skeletalTransformSpace. See SteamVR_Skeleton_JointIndexes for bone indexes.
From the previous update: An array of the rotations of the bones from the most recent update. Relative to skeletalTransformSpace. See SteamVR_Skeleton_JointIndexes for bone indexes.
The range of motion the we're using to get bone data from. With Controller being your hand while holding the controller.
The space to get bone data in. Parent space by default
Get the accuracy level of the skeletal tracking data.

* Estimated: Body part location canâ€™t be directly determined by the device. Any skeletal pose provided by the device is estimated based on the active buttons, triggers, joysticks, or other input sensors. Examples include the Vive Controller and gamepads.

* Partial: Body part location can be measured directly but with fewer degrees of freedom than the actual body part.Certain body part positions may be unmeasured by the device and estimated from other input data.Examples include Knuckles or gloves that only measure finger curl

* Full: Body part location can be measured directly throughout the entire range of motion of the body part.Examples include hi-end mocap systems, or gloves that measure the rotation of each finger segment.
A 0-1 value representing how curled the thumb is. 0 being straight, 1 being fully curled.
A 0-1 value representing how curled the index finger is. 0 being straight, 1 being fully curled.
A 0-1 value representing how curled the middle finger is. 0 being straight, 1 being fully curled.
A 0-1 value representing how curled the ring finger is. 0 being straight, 1 being fully curled.
A 0-1 value representing how curled the pinky finger is. 0 being straight, 1 being fully curled.
A 0-1 value representing the size of the gap between the thumb and index fingers
A 0-1 value representing the size of the gap between the index and middle fingers
A 0-1 value representing the size of the gap between the middle and ring fingers
A 0-1 value representing the size of the gap between the ring and pinky fingers
[Previous Update] A 0-1 value representing how curled the thumb is. 0 being straight, 1 being fully curled.
[Previous Update] A 0-1 value representing how curled the index finger is. 0 being straight, 1 being fully curled.
[Previous Update] A 0-1 value representing how curled the middle finger is. 0 being straight, 1 being fully curled.
[Previous Update] A 0-1 value representing how curled the ring finger is. 0 being straight, 1 being fully curled.
[Previous Update] A 0-1 value representing how curled the pinky finger is. 0 being straight, 1 being fully curled.
[Previous Update] A 0-1 value representing the size of the gap between the thumb and index fingers
[Previous Update] A 0-1 value representing the size of the gap between the index and middle fingers
[Previous Update] A 0-1 value representing the size of the gap between the middle and ring fingers
[Previous Update] A 0-1 value representing the size of the gap between the ring and pinky fingers
0-1 values representing how curled the specified finger is. 0 being straight, 1 being fully curled. For indexes see: SteamVR_Skeleton_FingerIndexes
0-1 values representing how splayed the specified finger and it's next index'd finger is. For indexes see: SteamVR_Skeleton_FingerIndexes
[Previous Update] 0-1 values representing how curled the specified finger is. 0 being straight, 1 being fully curled. For indexes see: SteamVR_Skeleton_FingerIndexes
[Previous Update] 0-1 values representing how splayed the specified finger and it's next index'd finger is. For indexes see: SteamVR_Skeleton_FingerIndexes
Separate from "changed". If the pose for this skeleton action has changed (root position/rotation)
The amount of time in the future (or past!) the input system will predict poses for. Default is one frame forward (at 90hz) to account for render time.
The number of bones in the skeleton for this action
[Should not be called by user code] Updates the skeleton action data
[Should not be called by user code] Updates the skeleton action data without firing events
Update a transform's local position and local roation to match the pose from the most recent update

parameterdescription.para: The transform of the object to be updated

briefdescription.para: True if this action is bound and the ActionSet is active
True if the ActionSet that contains this action is active

memberdef.argsstring: (float secondsFromNow, out Vector3 velocity, out Vector3 angularVelocity)
memberdef.name: GetVelocitiesAtTimeOffset

briefdescription.para: SteamVR keeps a log of past poses so you can retrieve old poses or estimated poses in the future by passing in a secondsFromNow value that is negative or positive.

parameterdescription.para: The time offset in the future (estimated) or in the past (previously recorded) you want to get data from

simplesect.para: true if we successfully returned a pose

memberdef.argsstring: (float secondsFromNow, out Vector3 position, out Quaternion rotation, out Vector3 velocity, out Vector3 angularVelocity)
memberdef.name: GetPoseAtTimeOffset

briefdescription.para: SteamVR keeps a log of past poses so you can retrieve old poses or estimated poses in the future by passing in a secondsFromNow value that is negative or positive.

parameterdescription.para: The time offset in the future (estimated) or in the past (previously recorded) you want to get data from

simplesect.para: true if we successfully returned a pose

briefdescription.para: The local position of the pose relative to the universe origin
The local rotation of the pose relative to the universe origin
The local velocity of the pose relative to the universe origin
The local angular velocity of the pose relative to the universe origin
True if the device bound to this action is connected
True if the pose retrieved for this action is valid (good data from the tracking source)
The state of the tracking system that is used to create pose data (position, rotation, etc)
The last local position of the pose relative to the universe origin
The last local rotation of the pose relative to the universe origin
The last local velocity of the pose relative to the universe origin
The last local angular velocity of the pose relative to the universe origin
True if the device bound to this action was connected during the previous update
True if the pose was valid during the previous update
The tracking state for this pose during the previous update
Gets the bone positions in local space. This array may be modified later so if you want to hold this data then pass true to get a copy of the data instead of the actual array

parameterdescription.para: This array may be modified later so if you want to hold this data then pass true to get a copy of the data instead of the actual array

briefdescription.para: Gets the bone rotations in local space. This array may be modified later so if you want to hold this data then pass true to get a copy of the data instead of the actual array

parameterdescription.para: This array may be modified later so if you want to hold this data then pass true to get a copy of the data instead of the actual array

briefdescription.para: Gets the bone positions in local space from the previous update. This array may be modified later so if you want to hold this data then pass true to get a copy of the data instead of the actual array

parameterdescription.para: This array may be modified later so if you want to hold this data then pass true to get a copy of the data instead of the actual array

briefdescription.para: Gets the bone rotations in local space from the previous update. This array may be modified later so if you want to hold this data then pass true to get a copy of the data instead of the actual array

parameterdescription.para: This array may be modified later so if you want to hold this data then pass true to get a copy of the data instead of the actual array

briefdescription.para: Set the range of the motion of the bones in this skeleton. Options are "With Controller" as if your hand is holding your VR controller. Or "Without Controller" as if your hand is empty. This will set the range for the following update.
Sets the space that you'll get bone data back in. Options are relative to the Model and relative to the Parent bone

parameterdescription.para: the space that you'll get bone data back in. Options are relative to the Model and relative to the Parent bone.

briefdescription.para: Returns the total number of bones in the skeleton
Returns the order of bones in the hierarchy
Returns the name of the bone
Returns an array of positions/rotations that represent the state of each bone in a reference pose.

parameterdescription.para: What to get the position/rotation data relative to, the model, or the bone's parent
Which reference pose to return

briefdescription.para: Get the accuracy level of the skeletal tracking data.

listitem.para: Estimated: Body part location canâ€™t be directly determined by the device. Any skeletal pose provided by the device is estimated based on the active buttons, triggers, joysticks, or other input sensors. Examples include the Vive Controller and gamepads.

Partial: Body part location can be measured directly but with fewer degrees of freedom than the actual body part.Certain body part positions may be unmeasured by the device and estimated from other input data.Examples include Knuckles or gloves that only measure finger curl

Full: Body part location can be measured directly throughout the entire range of motion of the body part.Examples include hi-end mocap systems, or gloves that measure the rotation of each finger segment.

briefdescription.para: Returns the finger curl data that we calculate each update. This array may be modified later so if you want to hold this data then pass true to get a copy of the data instead of the actual array

parameterdescription.para: This array may be modified later so if you want to hold this data then pass true to get a copy of the data instead of the actual array

briefdescription.para: Returns the finger curl data from the previous update. This array may be modified later so if you want to hold this data then pass true to get a copy of the data instead of the actual array

parameterdescription.para: This array may be modified later so if you want to hold this data then pass true to get a copy of the data instead of the actual array

briefdescription.para: Returns the finger splay data that we calculate each update. This array may be modified later so if you want to hold this data then pass true to get a copy of the data instead of the actual array

parameterdescription.para: This array may be modified later so if you want to hold this data then pass true to get a copy of the data instead of the actual array

briefdescription.para: Returns the finger splay data from the previous update. This array may be modified later so if you want to hold this data then pass true to get a copy of the data instead of the actual array

parameterdescription.para: This array may be modified later so if you want to hold this data then pass true to get a copy of the data instead of the actual array

briefdescription.para: Returns a value indicating how much the passed in finger is currently curled.

parameterdescription.para: The index of the finger to return a curl value for. 0-4. thumb, index, middle, ring, pinky

simplesect.para: 0-1 value. 0 being straight, 1 being fully curled.

briefdescription.para: Returns a value indicating how the size of the gap between fingers.

parameterdescription.para: The index of the finger gap to return a splay value for. 0 being the gap between thumb and index, 1 being the gap between index and middle, 2 being the gap between middle and ring, and 3 being the gap between ring and pinky.

simplesect.para: 0-1 value. 0 being no gap, 1 being "full" gap

briefdescription.para: Returns a value indicating how much the passed in finger is currently curled.

parameterdescription.para: The finger to return a curl value for

simplesect.para: 0-1 value. 0 being straight, 1 being fully curled.

briefdescription.para: Returns a value indicating how the size of the gap between fingers.

parameterdescription.para: The finger gap to return a splay value for.

simplesect.para: 0-1 value. 0 being no gap, 1 being "full" gap

briefdescription.para: Returns a value indicating how much the passed in finger was curled during the previous update

parameterdescription.para: The index of the finger to return a curl value for. 0-4. thumb, index, middle, ring, pinky

simplesect.para: 0-1 value. 0 being straight, 1 being fully curled.

briefdescription.para: Returns a value indicating the size of the gap between fingers during the previous update

parameterdescription.para: The index of the finger gap to return a splay value for. 0 being the gap between thumb and index, 1 being the gap between index and middle, 2 being the gap between middle and ring, and 3 being the gap between ring and pinky.

simplesect.para: 0-1 value. 0 being no gap, 1 being "full" gap

briefdescription.para: Returns a value indicating how much the passed in finger was curled during the previous update

parameterdescription.para: The finger to return a curl value for

simplesect.para: 0-1 value. 0 being straight, 1 being fully curled.

briefdescription.para: Returns a value indicating the size of the gap between fingers during the previous update

parameterdescription.para: The finger gap to return a splay value for.

simplesect.para: 0-1 value. 0 being no gap, 1 being "full" gap

briefdescription.para: Gets the localized name of the device that the action corresponds to. Include as many EVRInputStringBits as you want to add to the localized string

listitem.para: VRInputString_Hand - Which hand the origin is in. ex: "Left Hand".
VRInputString_ControllerType - What kind of controller the user has in that hand. ex: "Vive Controller".
VRInputString_InputSource - What part of that controller is the origin. ex: "Trackpad".
VRInputString_All - All of the above. ex: "Left Hand Vive Controller Trackpad".

briefdescription.para: Fires an event when a device is connected or disconnected.

parameterdescription.para: The method you would like to be called when a device is connected. Should take a SteamVR_Action_Pose as a param

briefdescription.para: Stops executing the function setup by the corresponding AddListener

parameterdescription.para: The method you would like to stop calling when a device is connected. Should take a SteamVR_Action_Pose as a param

briefdescription.para: Fires an event when the tracking of the device has changed

parameterdescription.para: The method you would like to be called when tracking has changed. Should take a SteamVR_Action_Pose as a param

briefdescription.para: Stops executing the function setup by the corresponding AddListener

parameterdescription.para: The method you would like to stop calling when tracking has changed. Should take a SteamVR_Action_Pose as a param

briefdescription.para: Fires an event when the device now has a valid pose or no longer has a valid pose

parameterdescription.para: The method you would like to be called when the pose has become valid or invalid. Should take a SteamVR_Action_Pose as a param

briefdescription.para: Stops executing the function setup by the corresponding AddListener

parameterdescription.para: The method you would like to stop calling when the pose has become valid or invalid. Should take a SteamVR_Action_Pose as a param

briefdescription.para: Executes a function when this action's bound state changes
Stops executing the function setup by the corresponding AddListener

parameterdescription.para: The local function that you've setup to receive update events

briefdescription.para: Executes a function when the state of this action changes

parameterdescription.para: A local function that receives the boolean action who's state has changed, the corresponding input source, and the new value

briefdescription.para: Stops executing the function setup by the corresponding AddListener

parameterdescription.para: The local function that you've setup to receive on change events

briefdescription.para: Executes a function when the state of this action is updated.

parameterdescription.para: A local function that receives the boolean action who's state has changed, the corresponding input source, and the new value

briefdescription.para: Stops executing the function setup by the corresponding AddListener

parameterdescription.para: The local function that you've setup to receive update events

briefdescription.para: Skeleton Actions are our best approximation of where your hands are while holding vr controllers and pressing buttons. We give you 31 bones to help you animate hand models. For more information check out this blog post: https://steamcommunity.com/games/250820/announcements/detail/1690421280625220068
